page.title: 11Totternhoe Village
page.content: Totternhoe is a small village to the South-West of Dunstable. It has a mixture of council and private houses. Some people work locally, others commute to London or Milton Keynes. There is an old church, called St. Giles and there is a Methodist Chapel. We have three pubs, two by the school and one by the Knolls. There is a Recreation Ground which is used by the Football Club. The Rec. also has swings for the children. There is a shop and Post Office, though most shopping is done in Dunstable or Luton. The village has cub, scout, brownie and guide groups. The W. I. and the Keep Fit groups meet in the school. This is a Lower School and caters for children from 5 to 9 years. The nearest Middle and Upper schools are in Dunstable. The Aylesbury to Luton bus goes through Totternhoe.
